questions.explanation:
7. How old is this building?
(A) To ship some materials. → Incorrect (answers about purpose, not age)
(B) About ten years old. → Correct (directly answers the age question)
(C) Company offices, I think. → Incorrect (addresses function, not age)

8. Can you come to my jazz performance tonight?
(A) I'm sorry I was late for the meeting. → Incorrect (unrelated to the question)
(B) Mostly just local musicians. → Incorrect (describes performers, not attendance)
(C) Sure, I'll be there! → Correct (directly confirms attendance)

9. Which apartment submitted a work order?
(A) It's what you did for a living. → Incorrect (unrelated to the question)
(B) Submit your assignment here. → Incorrect (refers to a different context)
(C) It came from the tenants in B23. → Correct (specifies the apartment)

10. Will you contact the vendor about changing our delivery date?
(A) Of course, I'll take care of it. → Correct (confirms action to contact vendor)
(B) An e-mail receipt. → Incorrect (unrelated to the question)
(C) Could I get change for a dollar? → Incorrect (irrelevant request)

11. Why was the maintenance worker here?
(A) No, he didn't. → Incorrect (does not explain the reason)
(B) From three o'clock until four. → Incorrect (addresses time, not reason)
(C) Because a light needed to be fixed. → Correct (explains the purpose)

12. Did management make a hiring decision yet?
(A) Put it on the highest shelf. → Incorrect (unrelated to hiring)
(B) The personnel department. → Incorrect (refers to a department, not a decision)
(C) Yes, they chose Jacob Borgman. → Correct (confirms the decision)

13. Do you want to eat here in our cafeteria or go out?
(A) He went there yesterday. → Incorrect (unrelated to the question)
(B) Well, maybe a sandwich. → Incorrect (specifies food, not location)
(C) Let's eat here. → Correct (chooses the cafeteria)

14. Didn't you e-mail the employment contract to Mr. Patel yesterday?
(A) Yes, I would agree. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated)
(B) No, I'll send it now. → Correct (directly addresses the action)
(C) Check the employee manual. → Incorrect (irrelevant suggestion)

15. Our division's picnic is this Saturday, right?
(A) There's a lot of rain in the forecast. → Incorrect (discusses weather, not date)
(B) Sure, I like salad. → Incorrect (mentions food, not date)
(C) At the end of this corridor. → Incorrect (refers to location, not date)
Note: No correct answer provided; correct answer should be, e.g., 'Yes, it's this Saturday.'

16. Would you like coffee or tea?
(A) Just water, please. → Correct (provides a clear preference)
(B) For a few dollars more. → Incorrect (unrelated to beverage choice)
(C) A fifteen-minute break. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

17. We achieved our sales targets this month.
(A) That's excellent news! → Correct (acknowledges the achievement)
(B) A few times a day. → Incorrect (unrelated to sales targets)
(C) To the end of April. → Incorrect (refers to time, not achievement)

18. How often do you travel for your job?
(A) It turned out well. → Incorrect (unrelated to frequency)
(B) Yes, I did find one. → Incorrect (irrelevant response)
(C) About once a month. → Correct (specifies frequency)

19. We should hike the Wildflower Trail today.
(A) This seat is available. → Incorrect (unrelated to hiking)
(B) I didn't bring boots. → Correct (relevant to hiking preparation)
(C) At the visitors' center. → Incorrect (refers to location, not agreement)

20. You've booked a hotel in London, haven't you?
(A) Very enjoyable, thanks. → Incorrect (unrelated to booking)
(B) He usually takes the train. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Yes, I made a reservation last week. → Correct (confirms booking)

21. Are there any tickets left for tonight's concert?
(A) It's sold out. → Correct (directly addresses ticket availability)
(B) He's a concert violinist. → Incorrect (unrelated to ticket availability)
(C) They already left. → Incorrect (refers to people, not tickets)

22. Haven't you used this software before?
(A) Can I take your order? → Incorrect (unrelated to software)
(B) I haven't had the chance. → Correct (addresses prior use)
(C) About 40 dollars. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not experience)

23. When is the new blender going to be released?
(A) Only with fruits and vegetables. → Incorrect (discusses use, not release)
(B) In the kitchen cabinet. → Incorrect (refers to location, not release)
(C) The prototype is still being tested. → Correct (implies release status)

24. Who's picking up our clients at the airport?
(A) They decided to drive. → Correct (explains why no one is picking up)
(B) At terminal 2. → Incorrect (specifies location, not person)
(C) It's a marketing position. → Incorrect (unrelated to the question)

25. Where are the red roses that came in this morning?
(A) About three liters of water. → Incorrect (unrelated to location)
(B) No, I didn't check out the sale. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I needed some for a large bouquet. → Incorrect (explains use, not location)
Note: No correct answer provided; correct answer should be, e.g., 'They're in the back room.'

26. This film has been nominated for several awards.
(A) Why don't we go see it? → Correct (logical response to the statement)
(B) After the announcement. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated)
(C) He made a great speech. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the film)

27. Who's interested in starting a car pool program?
(A) Thanks, but I can't swim. → Incorrect (unrelated to car pooling)
(B) Clara's already organizing one. → Correct (identifies an interested person)
(C) It's a very interesting article. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

28. Where will I teach my workshop this month?
(A) We just sent an e-mail to all instructors. → Correct (implies location info sent)
(B) Five to seven months. → Incorrect (refers to time, not location)
(C) Yes, it's a beautiful building. → Incorrect (vague and not specific)

29. Why are we moving these sweaters to the back of the store?
(A) In the new shopping mall. → Incorrect (refers to location, not reason)
(B) Yes, they come in other colors. → Incorrect (unrelated to moving)
(C) Our spring merchandise is arriving soon. → Correct (explains the reason)

30. Would you be interested in working on some of these contracts?
(A) Thank you for meeting me. → Incorrect (unrelated to contracts)
(B) A contact lens prescription. → Incorrect (misinterprets 'contracts')
(C) I have very limited time. → Correct (addresses interest indirectly)

31. What type of job are you looking for?
(A) No, at ten A.M. → Incorrect (refers to time, not job type)
(B) I really like working with computers. → Correct (specifies job type)
(C) Just a résumé is needed. → Incorrect (unrelated to job type)
